message.title: The very 1st message of all Multiple breaking news messages - test

itemsSpecific.title: Health Care Specialists Consider Different Treatments for Ebola
itemsSpecific.intro: In West Africa, the World Health Organization says the Ebola virus has so far infected over 3,700 people and killed over 1,800. There is no cure for disease, and a potential vaccine could be months, or years, away.

itemsSpecific.title: Tens of Thousands of Pro-Democracy Protesters in Hong Kong Refuse to Disperse
itemsSpecific.intro: Tens of Thousands of Pro-Democracy Protesters in Hong Kong Refuse to Disperse

itemsSpecific.title: American Detained in North Korea Life
itemsSpecific.intro: American Detained in North Korea Describes Hard Life

itemsSpecific.title: Raw Video: Interview with Hong Kong Student Protesters
itemsSpecific.intro: Pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong continued to defy China on Monday despite calls for them to disperse. Thousands of protesters have taken over usually busy streets in key parts of the Asian financial hub and Beijing has warned against foreign interference.

itemsSpecific.title: Japan Rescue Search for Victims of Mount Ontake Volcano Eruption
itemsSpecific.intro: More than 30 people were presumed dead on Sunday near the peak of a Japanese volcano, Mount Ontake, that erupted unexpectedly a day earlier while it was packed with hikers out to admire autumn foliage, sending a huge cloud of ash and rock tumbling down its slopes.

itemsSpecific.title: UN Prosecutors Seeking Maximum Penalty for Karadzic
itemsSpecific.intro: Life in prison sought for former Bosnian Serb leader accused of genocide, other crimes committed during 1990s Balkan war

itemsSpecific.title: Treasure Hunters Seek 'Hidden Treasure' in Central Kenya
itemsSpecific.intro: Could a cave in a small village in central Kenya be the site of buried treasure? A rumor of riches, left behind by colonialists, has some residents dreaming of wealth, while others see it as a dangerous hoax. VOA's Gabe Joselow has the story.

itemsSpecific.title: Intersecting Cultures, Languages in New Play of NYC Neighborhood
itemsSpecific.intro: Four years ago, theater artist Ari Laura Kreith founded a theater company to present plays reflecting the multicultural, multilingual lives in her New York City neighborhood of Jackson Heights.

itemsSpecific.title: Popes Francis, Benedict Stress Importance of Elderly in Society
itemsSpecific.intro: Francis seeks to underscore importance of the elderly in society, says nursing homes should not be allowed to become 'prisons,' run for profit rather than care

itemsSpecific.title: Apple Announces the new iPhone 6
itemsSpecific.intro: After months of rampant speculation (and an abnormally high number of apparent leaks), the new iPhone has arrived. In fact, two new iPhones have arrived — the iPhone 6, and the iPhone 6 Plus.

itemsSpecific.title: Watchdog: Kremlin Internet Plans Could Endanger Free Speech
itemsSpecific.intro: Russian proposals on protecting Internet users against threats from the West could be a Kremlin ploy to crack down on critical voices inside Russia, a representative of Europe's main rights and democracy watchdog said.
